channel.title: Learn :: DevDocs Navigation Menu Test
channel.description: Learn about Okta and Identity Access Management Click here to give feedback about this page Section Notes The Learn section targets all developers new to Identity Access Management and/or Okta. It covers An overview of the Workforce Identity Cloud (WIC) Basic IAM concepts and how Okta implements them Basic Okta-specific knowledge that all developers should know. An overview of Lifecycle Management The Okta Integration Network Tools for automating processes with Okta The goal of this section is to empower these developers to be successful in developing applications and OIN integrations using Okta’s products.

item.title: Workforce Identity Cloud (WIC)
item.description: Workforce Identity Cloud (WIC) overview Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta, Independent software vendor (ISV) Description: Explains WIC and compares it to the CIC domain. Describes the domain of what developer.okta.com covers. Why is this here?: 26% of respondents could not identify Workforce Identity Cloud despite “Workforce” being in the definition.

item.title: Identity Access Management (IAM)
item.description: Identity Access Management (IAM) basics Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Description: Explains Identity Access Management at a high level Links to original docs: Identity and Access Management (IAM) overview: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/iam-overview/ Why is this here?: Respondents with IAM experience level lower that 5 say that they rarely come to the site.

item.title: Application Types
item.description: Types of application you can build Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Description: Explains at a high level the different types of applications developers can build as Okta defines them. Also, why you’d want to build them in the first place. Web applications (OIDC, SAML, SWA) API Service Apps Lifecycle apps (SCIM and Workflow Connectors)) Expands “Create your own integration in Okta” to be more of a thought-leading piece about making any type of app public or private and the pros and cons of that decision.

item.title: Multifactor Authentication (MFA)
item.description: Multifactor Authentication (MFA) Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Description: Explain the basic concept of MFA, and the difference between a Authentication Factor and an Authenticator. Why is this here?: At Oktane 2023, 20% of respondents placed “Multi-factor Authentication” under “IAM Fundamentals”. After discussions with employees (and probably customers as well) there is a misunderstanding of what is a “Factor” and what is an Authenticator".

item.title: Single Sign-On (SSO)
item.description: Single Sign-On (SSO) at Okta Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: New doc with new content but also pulling from existing content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Description: Answers “What is SSO?”, how it differs from a basic sign in, and “How Okta supports it”. Also “How does a user experience SSO from the Okta End User Dashboard or from another place?

item.title: OAuth and OIDC
item.description: OAuth and OIDC Explained Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Existing doc: no changes needed to fit the new IA Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Links to original docs: OAuth 2.0 and OpenID Connect overview: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/oauth-openid/ Page type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview Conceptual overviews present a high-level introduction to a topic. Such high-level overviews provide developers with a broad understanding of the system’s workings.

item.title: SAML
item.description: Understand SAML Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Existing doc: changes are needed to update the doc and to fit the new IA Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Changes to be made: Update the flow charts away from Plant UML to use the Figma design. Links to original docs: SAML: https://developer.okta.com/docs/concepts/saml/ Page type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview

item.title: Okta Basics
item.description: Okta Basics Click here to give feedback about this page Section Notes The Okta Basics section gives new-to-IAM or new-to-Okta developers an introduction to Okta-specific basic concepts that they will need to build solutions that integrate with Okta. About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Why is this here?: Respondents with an IAM experience level lower than 5 say that the developer docs “Needs improvement” Respondents with IAM experience level lower that 5 say that they rarely come to the site See Learn (ID: 1)

item.title: Single Logout (SLO) and Universal Logout (UL)
item.description: Single Logout (SLO) and Universal Logout (UL) Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: New doc with new content but also pulling from existing content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Description: Summary overview of the two sign-out products from Okta, paying special attention to the scenarios in which they will apply. One of the goals is to have readers understand the difference between the two products, their limitations and where to find more info on how to implement them in their apps.

item.title: Automation Tools
item.description: Okta Automation Tools Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Page type: Navigation Content type: Autogenerated Index An autogenerated index is an automatically generated list of links to topics immediately beneath it based purely on the site’s structure, or with some level of filtering. A blind list of summaries and links to child docs.

item.title: User Lifecycle Management (LCM)
item.description: User Lifecycle Management (LCM) Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Description: An overview of lifecycle management and why we care about it, or at least why Enterprise app vendors care about it, and what that means for developers who need to incorporate it. Add emphasis on user provisioning and deprovisioning in this doc.

item.title: Identity Governance
item.description: Identity Governance Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Description: This guide defines and outlines PAM, IGA, and the differences between them and IAM, and how you have to pay for them separately as they are enabled in different SKUs. Page type: Concept Content type: Conceptual overview

item.title: Okta Integration Network (OIN)
item.description: Okta Integration Network (OIN) Click here to give feedback about this page About This Page Is this a new page?: Completely new doc with new content Target personas: New IAM Developers, Developers new to Okta Description: An introduction to the OIN, what it is, what an integration is, different types of integration in the OIN, differences between OIN Manager and OIN Wizard, why publish to the OIN at all? Lists reasons why people / ISVs should care about publishing on the OIN in the first place.
